Evidence Statements: The student can create a drawing that shows what ice looks like before it melts.
The student can illustrate what happens to ice when it is heated and turns into water.
The student can represent what happens when heated water is cooled down and turns back into ice.
The student can include in their drawing any evidence that shows melting ice into water is a change that can be reversed.
The student can include reasons why some changes caused by heating cannot be reversed in their drawing, by adding examples like a cooked egg or melted chocolate.
